author: juvtib
body:
I want to access the `InstalledLocation` for a module using `Select-Xml`, but I can't specify the exact XPath expression. I'm only able to use a position or to search for the attribute. There appears to be a problem with `Select-Xml` or `SelectNodes()`. 

Below we have the call I would like to make, a demonstration of the `SelectXmlInfo` I'm after, and a list of `@InstalledLocation`'s ancestors. 

## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
(Get-Package SharePointPnPPowerShellOnline).SwIdTagText | Select-Xml -XPath '/SoftwareIdentity/Meta/@InstalledLocation'

(Get-Package SharePointPnPPowerShellOnline).SwIdTagText | Select-Xml -XPath '/self::node()/child::node()/child::node()[1]/attribute::node()[8]'

(Get-Package SharePointPnPPowerShellOnline).SwIdTagText | Select-Xml -XPath '//@InstalledLocation/ancestor::node()'
```

## Expected behavior

```none
Node              Path        Pattern
----              ----        -------
InstalledLocation InputStream /SoftwareIdentity/Meta/@InstalledLocation

Node              Path        Pattern
----              ----        -------
InstalledLocation InputStream /self::node()/child::node()/child::node()[1]/att…

Node             Path        Pattern
----             ----        -------
#document        InputStream //@InstalledLocation/ancestor::node()
SoftwareIdentity InputStream //@InstalledLocation/ancestor::node()
Meta             InputStream //@InstalledLocation/ancestor::node()
```

## Actual behavior

```none
# no output

Node              Path        Pattern
----              ----        -------
InstalledLocation InputStream /self::node()/child::node()/child::node()[1]/att…

Node             Path        Pattern
----             ----        -------
#document        InputStream //@InstalledLocation/ancestor::node()
SoftwareIdentity InputStream //@InstalledLocation/ancestor::node()
Meta             InputStream //@InstalledLocation/ancestor::node()
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19042
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body: SWID XML files use namespace, requiring use of `Select-Xml`'s `-NameSpace` parameter; see [this Stack Overflow answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/49387055/45375) for an example.

title: Can't Select Node from SwIdTagText Using Node Names
